name: Egyptian Aviation Academy
about: The Egyptian Aviation Academy, established in 1932, is a pioneering institution in aviation training in the Middle East and Africa. It operates three main colleges: Misr Flying College, offering courses such as Private Pilot License (PPL), Commercial Pilot License (CPL), and Instrument Rating; Air Traffic Control College, providing training in air traffic control and related fields; and Civil Aviation Management Training College, focusing on aircraft maintenance, airport operations, and aviation management. Recognized by the International Civil Aviation Organization, the academy is committed to providing world-class training that meets market demands, emphasizing safety, flexibility, and teamwork. With a fleet of 28 training aircraft and state-of-the-art facilities, the Egyptian Aviation Academy is dedicated to producing highly qualified aviation professionals.
